com.ca.mas.core.storage.sharedstorage

Class MASSharedStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ca.mas.core.storage.sharedstorage.MASSharedStorage

  • public class MASSharedStorage
extends java.lang.Object
    MASSharedStorage is designed for developers to write, read, and delete String or byte[] data into the AccountManager so that multiple applications signed with the same key and using the same account name can share data. Note: the framework should be initialized prior to using any of MASSharedStorage's CRUD operations.

    Requires the android.permission.AUTHENTICATE_ACCOUNTS and android:name="android.permission.MANAGE_ACCOUNTS" permissions in your application's AndroidManifest.xml.

    By default, the massharedauthenticator.xml file will be used to create the accounts, but can be overridden in AndroidManifest.xml with your own xml file for another account type.

      Creates or retrieves a MASSharedStorage with the specified name and account type.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MASSharedStorage

        public MASSharedStorage(@NonNull
                        java.lang.String accountName)
        Creates or retrieves a MASSharedStorage with the specified name and account type. Ensure that this does not conflict with any existing accountType on the device.
        Parameters:
        accountName - the name of the account to be created in the AccountManager

    • Method Detail

      • save

        public void save(@NonNull
                 java.lang.String key,
                 java.lang.String value)
        Saves a string value with the given key into the shared storage.
        Parameters:
        key - string of the key to store the string value
        value - the string value to be stored

      • save

        public void save(@NonNull
                 java.lang.String key,
                 byte[] value)
        Saves a byte array with the given key into the shared storage.
        Parameters:
        key - string of the key to store the byte[] value
        value - the byte[] value to be stored

      • delete

        public void delete(@NonNull
                   java.lang.String key)
        Deletes any data with the given key in the shared storage. Functionally the same as calling save(key, null).
        Parameters:
        key - string of the key to be deleted

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String key)
        Retrieves a string value in the shared storage given by the key.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
